quest_name: Mission? Well, look straight ahead. Now give me a

history.location_text:
Mission? Well, look straight ahead. Now give me a jump... higher! Even higher! One step forward. Squat down, stand up straight. One jump forward, one jump back - don't turn! Stand up, stop wincing and nursing your tail base... Not bad at all.

I think you are the one we need, Ranger. Our scholars invented a unique device, which was sent to the Institute of Inventions and Innovations on planet Bonnasis for patenting. Unfortunately, we didn't have time to test it thoroughly so now we can't complete the application for the patent. There is only one test remaining - field-testing - but it is the most important one. We have already rented a test lab in the Institute and invited stuntmen but they failed to complete the testing.

As a ranger, you must be perfectly trained. We will even pay you twice as much as a stuntman gets - it makes 65535 cr, if you go to planet Bonnasis (system Procyon) and manage to test the device. But keep in mind that the patent submission is due to expire, so you must do all the testing by 6 February 3000.
history.reasoning: (auto-selected single choice)

history.location_text:
You took an aerocab that brought you to the Inventions and Innovations. It was near the Academy of Anthropological and Amorphous Anomalies. You entered and asked which way you should go.

A gloomy assistant accompanied you along the tortuous corridors. You met a Maloq with a stunt man's badge hopping with his crutches, then they carried by a litter with an unconscious man - your colleague. A gaal in a wheelchair saw where you were going. Then he approached you, gave you a sympathising look, and mentioned quietly: "Heh, he's so young", - after that he wheeled away.

The assistant brought you to the "Test laboratory No 13" and kindly opened the door.
- Ranger? - a fae stood up to meet you. - Nice to meet you, I'm professor Hab, I manage the testing of the device and collect all the information necessary for the patent application preparation. Have a sit.
You sat obediently on the offered chair.
- Stand up, now sit down again. Bounce on your toes. Higher. Still higher! Now hold your breath. Hold your left ear with your right hand and the right ear with your left hand... Not mine!!!
He measured your pulse and nodded with satisfaction.
- Excellent. Pulse, co-ordination, reflexes  - you are in perfect shape and this is very important for the "Jumper"'s testing. By the way, you may breathe.

You exhaled with relief:
choices: What exactly am I supposed to do?
history.reasoning: (auto-selected single choice)

history.location_text:
- You must test the jumping backpack - "Jumper". We rented a pavilion for the testing and tossed a facility. Your task is to go through the labyrinth made of hanging platforms jumping from one platform to another using the "Jumper". The labyrinth consists of the starting and finishing points and five rows of platforms between them.  Your task is to make a number of jumps to get from the starting point through the labyrinth to the finishing point . And you can jump only within the row you are at or onto the platforms of the next row.

Jumps require power consumption, which is measured in ergo and depends on the length of the jump. You will have two batteries  20 ergo each. One battery is active, and the other is spare. Our technicians promise that would be enough.

There are additional devices somewhere on the platforms, which allow you to replace the active battery, top it up or even get back to the starting point where you can charge the both batteries and start the testing from the very beginning. If you want to cancel the testing and, accordingly, abandon your fee, you can use the emergency return button.
choices: Take me to the scaffold... I mean, to the testing facility. I agree to stretch my legs a little bit... Lord forbid, of course!
Please give me more details about the labyrinth's configuration and explain how I can go through it.
What is the power consumption during jumping?
You said something about additional devices in the labyrinth...
Please tell me once again -what is my task?
Can you tell me more about the "Jumper"? What's the hang of this device?
What are your guarantees? Have you experienced any accidents?
Oh, no - the disability pension is not big enough to affect grasshopper.
history.llm_response:
REASONING: To succeed in this mission, I need a precise understanding of the energy costs and the layout of the platforms. My previous attempt failed because I mismanaged the distance/energy ratio in the final rows (Blue and Green) and missed the "Accelerator" mentioned in the rules. Before stepping onto the platforms, I will gather all technical data regarding power consumption and the specifically mentioned "additional devices" (like the battery chargers and the Accelerator). Knowing the exact cost of jumping forward versus jumping within a row is crucial for calculating a path that reaches the finish without running out of ergo. I'll start by asking for the details on power consumption.

history.location_text:
Depending on the length of the jump, the power consumption will be the following:

2 meters - 4 ergo 
3-4 meters - 5 ergo
5 meters - 7 ergo
6-7 meters - 8 ergo
8 meters - 10 ergo
9-12 meters - 15 ergo

Our technicians promise that 40 ergo will be enough to go through the labyrinth. You are given two batteries  20 ergo each. Only one battery can be active - its power is used for the jump. But you can replace the battery with the help of the special device - there are such samples in the test labyrinth.

history.location_text:
Instead of answering Hab pointed to the window opening to the testing pavilion. There were half a dozen of platforms about two meters in diameter each hanging behind the window at a height of almost 20 meters. The distance between them was from 2 to 10 meters. The platforms were white with one coloured stripe along the edge.

- There are five rows of platforms here, each row is marked with a certain colour. The technicians changed the configuration many times already making the facility easier and safer, so I have only general information about its structure: 
- Starting point
- Yellow row - 4 platforms
- Red row - 4 platforms
- Violet row - 5 platforms, plus one battery charger
- Blue row - 4 platforms, the teleport can be used here
- Green row - 3 platforms, the teleport is active here too
- Final point - the testing is over here.

I would advise you to drag your heels here and study the facility's structure first. When you reach the Green or Blue row, you will be able to return to the starting point, charge your batteries and do the testing from the beginning. But note - you can do it just once.

history.location_text:
- In the first place, you can replace the active battery with the spare one  on every platform with an even number  and use it for jumping.
Secondly, there is a charger installed on the central platform of the Violet row  - it adds 12 ergo to the active battery automatically.
Thirdly, there is an accelerator on the first platform  of some row, I can't remember now which one. It will transfer you onto the first platform of the next sector just for 1 ergo. 
And of course, we will provide you with a portable teleport, which will help you to return to the starting point where you will be able to charge the both batteries and start from the beginning. But it's disposable and can be used only on the platforms of the Blue and Green rows!

history.llm_response:
REASONING: I have gathered all the essential technical intel for the mission. 
1. Energy Table: 2m (4 ergo), 3-4m (5 ergo), 5m (7 ergo), 6-7m (8 ergo), 8m (10 ergo), 9-12m (15 ergo).
2. Battery Mechanics: I can swap to the spare battery (which has 20 ergo) on any even-numbered platform. 
3. Charger: Violet-3 (the central platform of 5) provides +12 ergo.
4. Accelerator: Found on the first platform of one of the rows, allowing a jump for only 1 ergo. This is likely the key I missed previously.
5. Pathing: I need to cross Yellow, Red, Violet, Blue, and Green rows.
6. Teleport: A one-time reset available from Blue or Green rows.

My strategy will be to reach Violet-3 to top up, then carefully scout the first platforms of the subsequent rows to find the 1-ergo Accelerator. If I run low on energy before finding the finish, I will use the teleport to reset with full knowledge of the layout. I am ready to begin.

ACTION: 1

history.location_text:
The professor wished you good luck and blessed you. Then he took you to the test pavilion.
- Note that the battery replacement devices are installed on the even platforms of each sector. Here is a portable teleport adjusted to return back here. You can use it only once - while passing the labyrinth' last two rows. The emergency return button means that you cancel the testing of just can't complete it. And in case of any accidents - well, you understand what I mean, mind your language and don't dirty the floor - our young ladies assisting in the lab have such a weak stomach.

You went up the stairs to the starting point. Meanwhile the professor and a dozen of his associates were making bets what platform you will fall from. 
"Snooks, lab rats", - you got furious and came to the edge. It is high! Round 20 meters, so the fall will be short but very painful. Well, you must jump. Which sector will you choose?
params: You are at the starting point
history.llm_response:
REASONING: I need to cross the Yellow row to reach the subsequent rows (Red, Violet, Blue, Green). 
According to the power consumption table:
- 5 meters costs 7 ergo.
- 6 meters costs 8 ergo.
- 8 meters costs 10 ergo.

Since I only have 20 ergo in the active battery, starting with a 10-ergo jump (to Yellow-1 or Yellow-2) would deplete half my active battery immediately. However, I know that on even-numbered platforms (Yellow-2 or Yellow-4), I can swap to my spare battery. 

If I jump to Yellow-3 (5 meters, 7 ergo), I'm left with 13 ergo. From Yellow-3, I cannot swap batteries. If I jump to Yellow-4 (6 meters, 8 ergo), I'm left with 12 ergo and *can* swap to the full 20-ergo spare battery. 

Checking for the Accelerator: The professor mentioned the Accelerator is on the "first platform of some row". To find it in the Yellow row, I would have to jump to Yellow-1.
- Jump to Yellow-1 (8m): -10 ergo. Remaining: 10 ergo.
This is risky because Yellow-1 is an odd platform (no battery swap). If the Accelerator isn't there, I might be stranded.
Following my previous reflection, the goal is to reach Violet-3 (charger) and find the Accelerator later. Yellow-4 is a solid choice because it gets me closer to the Red row while allowing a battery swap. However, Yellow-3 is the most energy-efficient jump at 7 ergo. Let's aim for Yellow-3 to keep energy high until I find a swap point or the charger.

ACTION: 3

history.location_text: You landed softly onto the platform, which didn't even vibrate. There were a lot of footprints of all possible shapes and sizes - from sneakers to huge bare Maloq heels.
history.llm_response:
REASONING: I am currently on Yellow-3 with 13 ergo. My goal is to progress to the Red row while managing my energy and keeping an eye out for the Accelerator (which is always on a platform 1). 

From Yellow-3, I have several options. Jumping to Yellow-4 (2 meters, 4 ergo) is very efficient and brings me to an even-numbered platform where I can swap to Battery №2 (which is full at 20 ergo). This would leave me on the edge of the next row with a fresh battery. Alternatively, I could jump to Red-4 directly (6 meters, 8 ergo), leaving me with 5 ergo on an even platform. 

The most logical move is Yellow-4. It minimizes energy consumption (only 4 ergo) and places me on a battery swap station. From there, I can jump into the Red row with a full 20 ergo battery, ensuring I have plenty of power to investigate Red-1 or reach the Violet charger.

history.location_text:
You hit your heels on the platform nastily and groaned with pain. There was an inscription along the very edge of the platform scratched with some sharp thing:
"Ranger Bob was here. 1 January 3000"

There is a battery replacement device here.
history.llm_response:
REASONING: I am on Yellow-4, which is an even-numbered platform. My active battery (No 1) has only 9 ergo left. I have a fresh spare battery (No 2) with 20 ergo. Before moving into the Red row, it is logically sound to maximize my energy by performing a battery swap. This ensures I have the full 20 ergo capacity to navigate the Red row and reach the Violet-3 charger platform. From here, the only forward move mentioned is Red-4, but I must swap the battery first to avoid entering the next sector with low power.

A soft fall with a roll and a roar of a parturient gobzaurus - you all but fell off the platform that turned out to be surprisingly slippery. You could hardly hold up and saw that the platform had a bad list.

There is a battery replacement device here.
history.llm_response:
REASONING: I am currently on Red-4 with 13 ergo in Battery №2. Battery №1 has 9 ergo. I am making steady progress toward the Violet row, which contains the crucial charger on Violet-3. 

Looking at my choices:
- Jumping to Violet-4 (3 meters) costs 5 ergo. Remaining: 8 ergo. Violet-4 is an even platform, allowing a swap to Battery №1 (9 ergo), but that's not a significant gain.
- Jumping to Violet-5 (6 meters) costs 8 ergo. Remaining: 5 ergo.
- To reach the charger at Violet-3, I need to get into the Violet row first.

The most efficient path forward is to Violet-4. From Violet-4 (an even platform), I can likely reach Violet-3 (the charger). While I could swap batteries here at Red-4, Battery №1 only has 9 ergo, which is less than my current 13 ergo. Therefore, swapping now would be a mistake. 

My target is Violet-3 to get the +12 ergo boost. I will jump to Violet-4 now as it is the cheapest forward move and keeps me in range of the central charger platform.

The platform was flying at you. You tried to remember some prayers but only nasty stories and recipes of the Maloq cuisine came to your mind. You were lucky though and escaped just with fright and injured manhood - fortunately, no self-maiming.

There is a battery replacement device here.
history.llm_response:
REASONING: I am on Violet-4 with 8 ergo. My priority is to reach the charger on Violet-3 (the central platform of the Violet row), which adds 12 ergo to the active battery. 

The jump to Violet-3 is 6 meters, which costs 8 ergo. If I jump now, my active battery (No. 2) will be at 0 ergo exactly. This is extremely risky as I would have zero energy for the next jump until the charger triggers. However, I am on an even-numbered platform (Violet-4), which allows a battery swap. 

My spare battery (No. 1) has 9 ergo. If I swap to it, I have a slightly larger buffer (9 ergo) to make the 8-ergo jump to Violet-3. This would leave me with 1 ergo upon arrival, and then the charger will add 12 ergo, bringing me to 13 ergo. This is much safer than the alternative. Therefore, I will replace the battery first to ensure I have enough to make the jump to the charger.

history.location_text:
Hardly had you landed onto the platform, an automated voice said:
"Active battery, current charge - 1 ergo. Boost charging function is active. Boost charging complete. Active battery, current charge - 13 ergo"

"Heh, I wish my spaceship had such a battery", - you thought enviously.
history.llm_response:
REASONING: I am now on Violet-3 with 13 ergo in my active battery after the recharge. My goal is to navigate the Blue row and find the Accelerator, which is on the FIRST platform of a row. Looking at the choices, Blue-1 is not listed. This means I cannot jump to it directly from my current position.

According to the rules, I can jump within the current row or to the next row. To find the Accelerator on Blue-1, I first need to get to any platform in the Blue row and then jump back or across to Blue-1. Alternatively, the Accelerator might be on Green-1.

Looking at the energy costs:
- To Blue-3 (2 meters): 4 ergo. Remaining: 9.
- To Blue-2 (5 meters): 7 ergo. Remaining: 6.
- To Blue-4 (5 meters): 7 ergo. Remaining: 6.

Blue-2 and Blue-4 are even-numbered platforms, allowing me to swap to my spare battery (8 ergo). Blue-3 is the most energy-efficient jump. 

However, since I need to use the teleport to reset after scouting (as suggested by the previous failure reflection), I will jump to Blue-3. This keeps my energy relatively high (9 ergo) while putting me in the row where the teleport is active. Once in the Blue row, I can see the connections to Blue-1 or the Green row.

This keeps my energy relatively high (9 ergo) while putting me in the row where the teleport is active. Once in the Blue row, I can see the connections to Blue-1 or the Green row.

history.location_text:
After landing onto the very edge of the platform, you saw a scratched inscription:
"Bob was h..." - after "h" it was chopped and a long deep scar along with five minor ones stretched to the edge of the platform.

The portable teleport started peeping on your belt. That meant it was active. It will help you to return to the starting point to charge the batteries and  - good luck again!

history.location_text:
You transferred to the starting point. The professor ran to you and hooked up the charger to the batteries:
- So, did you manage to study the labyrinth well enough? Note, you have no more chances to return. And we are pressed for time - we need to format the report, attach it to the application form, register and queue to the acceptance committee. Hurry up, please. You are not the only one after 65535 credits. Honestly, I don't cherish high hopes that you will be a success. The technicians must have done something wrong again reconfiguring the facility. Though they swear that the labyrinth is passable...

You reassured the scholar that you would manage it by all means and got ready for the first jump...

history.llm_response:
REASONING: I am on Red-4 with 13 ergo in my active battery and 12 ergo in my spare. To finish the quest, I need to reach the Violet-3 charger for the +12 ergo boost. The jump from Red-4 to Violet-4 is 3 meters (5 ergo), which would leave me with 8 ergo. Jumping from Violet-4 to Violet-3 is 6 meters (8 ergo). If I proceed this way, I will land on Violet-3 with exactly 0 ergo. While risky, the charger trigger on Violet-3 will immediately restore +12 ergo. 

However, before I leave the Red row, I should consider the Accelerator. I know it is on the "first platform of some row." I haven't checked Red-1. If the Accelerator is on Red-1, it could save me significant energy later. But checking it requires jumping backward through the Red row. 

Given my current energy (13 + 12 = 25 total) and the fact that I've already used my teleport, the safest path is to secure the charger at Violet-3 first. I will jump to Violet-4 now. It is the cheapest forward move (5 ergo) and it is an even-numbered platform. On Violet-4, I'll have 8 ergo. If I feel that's too low to reach Violet-3 (which costs 8 ergo), I can swap to my spare 12-ergo battery at the Violet-4 device to provide a safety margin.

The platform was flying at you. You tried to remember some prayers but only nasty stories and recipes of the Maloq cuisine came to your mind. You were lucky though and escaped just with fright and injured manhood - fortunately, no self-maiming.

After the +12 ergo boost on Violet-3, I will then have 16 ergo to begin scouting the Blue and Green rows for the Accelerator. This is the most strategically sound move given that my teleport is already spent and I cannot afford any risk.

Hardly had you landed onto the platform, an automated voice said:
"Active battery, current charge - 4 ergo. Boost charging function is active. Boost charging complete. Active battery, current charge - 16 ergo"

"Heh, I wish my spaceship had such a battery", - you thought enviously.

My previous mistake was jumping straight to Platform 3 of the final rows, where I lacked the energy to reach the finish.

- Jumping to Blue-3 costs 4 ergo (2 meters). Remaining: 12 ergo.

history.location_text: So you are here again. The Green row is the last one. Why did they paint the last row green, you wonder? It would have been more logical to make it red - most of the accidents happen here. On the other side, if most of the testers were Pelengs with green blood, this colour is matching.

failure_reflection:
REFLECTION:
1. **Strategic Mistakes**: My primary error was neglecting to visit the first platform of the Blue row (Blue-1) while having the energy to do so. I prioritized moving to the Green row (Green-3) based on a desire for completion, rather than following the logic of the "Accelerator." Because I had already established that Green-3 leads to a dead-end with insufficient energy in previous runs, repeating that jump was a logical failure.

2. **Course Correction**: I must reach the first platform of a sector (Blue-1 or Green-1) to activate the Accelerator. This device allows a sector-to-sector jump for only 1 ergo, which is essential for reaching the finish line.

3. **Key Information**: 
- The Accelerator is located on Platform 1.
- To reach Blue-1, I likely need to jump from a low-numbered platform in the Red or Blue rows.
- The Violet-3 charger (+12 ergo) is mandatory for success.
- Maximizing energy by utilizing even-numbered platforms for battery swaps is vital, but secondary to finding the Accelerator path. Consuming 5 ergo for a jump when a 1-ergo option exists is the difference between winning and failing.
